frame.name: Suitability
frame.definition:
<def-root>This Frame is concerned with evaluating an <fen>Evaluee</fen> as being suitable for a <fen>Purpose</fen> or a <fen>User</fen>, presupposing some choice that is being made about which <fen>Evaluee</fen> to use for the <fen>Purpose</fen> or <fen>User</fen>. An LU like suitable.a thus implies that, given a particular <fen>Purpose</fen> or <fen>User</fen>, the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is one which could be or ought to be chosen. The <fen>Evaluee</fen> may be deemed suitable to a greater or lesser <fen>Degree</fen>. This frame has some similarity to the compatibility frame where two Items are evaluated with respect to their compatibility with each other against some background.
<ex>(1) We need to build <fex name="Evaluee">more houses</fex> <t>suitable</t> <fex name="User">for local residents</fex>.</ex> <ex>(2) <fex name="Evaluee">These chips</fex> are not <fex name="Degree">very</fex><t>suitable</t> <fex name="Purpose">for parallel processing</fex>. </ex> <ex>(3) We are not sure about <fex name="Evaluee">the Cathedral's</fex> <t>suitability</t> <fex name="Purpose">for Philharmonic concerts</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Evaluee
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element marks constituents expressing the entity that is judged to be more or less suitable for some <fen>Purpose</fen> or <fen>User</fen>.
<ex>Being a project leader is not a job for which <fex name="Evaluee">everybody</fex> is <t>suited</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element marks constituents that express the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is suitable for the Context.
<ex>Please advise on the <fex name="Degree">most</fex> <t>suitable</t> design </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>This Frame Element marks constituents that express the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged to be suitable or unsuitable.
<ex>We need to plan more buildings <t>suitable</t> <fex name="Purpose">for disabled people</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: User
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE marks expressions that indicate a <fen>User</fen> to whom </def-root>

lexUnit.name: suitable.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: right or appropriate for a particular person, purpose, or situation

lexUnit.name: suitability.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: state or degree of being suitable for some purpose

lexUnit.name: unsuitability.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state or degree of being unsuitable for some purpose

lexUnit.name: suitableness.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of being suitable for some purpose

lexUnit.name: unsuitableness.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the state of not being suitable for some purpose

lexUnit.name: fit.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: of a suitable quality, standard, or type

lexUnit.name: fit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: be or make suitable for.

lexUnit.name: suit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: go well with or enhance the features, figure, or character of (someone).

lexUnit.name: become.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: matching a person's perceived character, aesthetically or behaviorally

lexUnit.name: appropriate.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: fitting or suitable for a particular entity or event

lexUnit.name: inappropriate.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: not fitting or suitable for an individual or situation
